org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.ltl

Class LTLUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.ltl.LTLUtil

  • public class LTLUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides some useful methods for processing LTL formulae.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      LTLUtil()

      static java.util.Collection<LTL> flatten(LTL f)
      Returns {f1, f2, ..., fn} for formulae of the form f1 /\ f2 /\ ...
      static int getNumberOfFutureOperators(LTL formula)

    • Method Detail

      • flatten

        public static java.util.Collection<LTL> flatten(LTL f)
        Returns {f1, f2, ..., fn} for formulae of the form f1 /\ f2 /\ ... /\ fn or f1 \/ f2 \/ ... \/ fn.
        Parameters:
        f - a LTL formula
        Returns:
        {f1, f2, ..., fn} if the formula is of the form f1 /\ f2 /\ ... /\ fn or f1 \/ f2 \/ ... \/ fn

      • getPropositionInLiteral

        public static Proposition getPropositionInLiteral(LTL lit)
        Returns the proposition in a literal.
        Parameters:
        lit - a literal
        Returns:
        the proposition in the literal or null if lit is not a literal

      • getTenseAlternation

        public static int getTenseAlternation(LTL formula)
        Return the number of alternations of future operators and past operators in a specified LTL formula.
        Parameters:
        formula - an LTL formula
        Returns:
        the number of alternations of future operators and past operators in the formula

      • getNumberOfPastOperators

        public static int getNumberOfPastOperators(LTL formula)
        Returns the number of past operators occur in a specified formula.
        Parameters:
        formula - an LTL formula
        Returns:
        the number of past operators occur in the formula

      • getNumberOfFutureOperators

        public static int getNumberOfFutureOperators(LTL formula)
        Returns the number of future operators occur in a specified formula.
        Parameters:
        formula - an LTL formula
        Returns:
        the number of future operators occur in the formula

      • isWeaklyEqual

        public static boolean isWeaklyEqual(LTL f,
                                    LTL g)
        Returns true if two formulae are syntactically equal with consideration of commutativity and negation. For example, p /\ (~ [] q) is weakly equal to (<> ~ q) /\ p.
        Parameters:
        f - a formula
        g - a formula
        Returns:
        true if two formulae are syntactically equal with consideration of commutativity and negation
